entry.headline: Goldman upgrades Bharti to buy, raises target price
entry.body:
NEW DELHI Nov 24 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs has upgraded Bharti Airtel (BRTI.BO) to buy from neutral and raised its target price on the stock of India's top mobile phone operator to 430 rupees.

"We believe that Bharti is the best positioned operator to benefit from the improving regulatory environment and likely better competitive environment in India," analysts at the U.S. investment bank wrote in a note.

"We believe the regulatory environment in the next 12-18 months will be more favorable to incumbents than new entrants," they said.

Bharti shares had closed at 329.15 rupees on Tuesday.

Goldman also raised its target price for India's sixth-biggest mobile phone operator, Idea Cellular (IDEA.BO), to 84 rupees, keeping its buy rating on the stock. The share closed at 71 rupees on Tuesday.

(Reporting by Devidutta Tripathy; Editing by Ranjit Gangadharan)

((devidutta.tripathy@thomsonreuters.com; +91 98187 86430; Reuters Messaging: devidutta.tripathy.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net))

((If you have a query or comment on this story, send an email to news.feedback.asia@thomsonreuters.com)) Keywords: BHARTI/UPRADE

entry.headline: Kyle Massey to Go from Ballroom to Wii Console Paint Brush in Celebration of the Launch of Disney Epic Mickey on November 30, 2010
entry.body:
Kyle Massey to Go from Ballroom to Wii™ Console Paint Brush in Celebration of the Launch of Disney Epic Mickey on November 30, 2010

Mickey Mouse Partners with Dancing Disney Star as 80 Years of Rich Disney History Waltzes Onto the Wii In Event at the New Disney Store in Times Square

Disney Interactive Studios today announced that Kyle Massey will be trading in his dancing shoes for a digital paint brush when the highly anticipated Disney Epic Mickey launches on November 30th for Wii. Massey will serve as the special celebrity cashier at the festivities taking place at the new Disney Store in Times Square.

Disney Epic Mickey (C) Disney

entry.headline: AMG`s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer to Present at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference 2010
entry.body:
AMG’s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer to Present at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference 2010

Darrell W. Crate, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Affiliated Managers Group, Inc. (NYSE: AMG), is expected to speak at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference 2010 in New York on Friday, December 3, 2010 at 2:15 p.m. Eastern time.

AMG will provide a live audio transmission of the comments through its website at www.amg.com/InvestorRelations. A replay of the webcast will also be available through AMG’s website shortly after the conclusion of management’s remarks.

About Affiliated Managers Group

AMG is a global asset management company with equity investments in leading boutique investment management firms. AMG’s innovative partnership approach allows each Affiliate’s management team to own significant equity in their firm while maintaining operational autonomy. AMG’s strategy is to generate growth through the internal growth of existing Affiliates, as well as through investments in new Affiliates. In addition, AMG provides centralized assistance to its Affiliates in strategic matters, marketing, distribution, product development and operations. As of September 30, 2010, the aggregate assets under management of AMG’s Affiliates were approximately $294 billion, pro forma for a pending investment, in more than 350 investment products across a broad range of investment styles, asset classes and distribution channels. For more information, please visit the Company’s website at www.amg.com.

Certain matters discussed in this press release may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the federal securities laws. Actual results and the timing of certain events could differ materially from those projected in or contemplated by the forward-looking statements due to a number of factors, including changes in the securities or financial markets or in general economic conditions, the availability of equity and debt financing, competition for acquisitions of interests in investment management firms, the ability to close pending investments, the investment performance of our Affiliates and their ability to effectively market their investment strategies, and other risks detailed from time to time in AMG’s filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Reference is hereby made to the “Cautionary Statements” set forth in the Company’s Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2009.

AMG routinely posts information that may be significant for investors in the Investor Information section of its website, and encourages investors to consult that section regularly. For additional information, please visit www.amg.com.

Investor Relations:Alexandra Lynn(617) 747-3300ir@amg.comorMedia Relations:Laura O’Brien(617) 747-3300pr@amg.com

entry.headline: Artio Global Investors to Present at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference 2010
entry.body:
Artio Global Investors to Present at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference 2010

Artio Global Investors Inc. (NYSE: ART) today announced that Glen Wisher, President, is scheduled to present at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference 2010 in New York City on Friday, December 3, at approximately 11:45 a.m. (Eastern Time).

A live audio webcast of the presentation will be available on the Investor Relations page of our website at www.ir.artioglobal.com. An audio replay will also be available at the same web address shortly after the event.

About the Company

Artio Global Investors Inc. is the indirect holding company of Artio Global Management LLC (“Artio Global”), a registered investment adviser headquartered in New York City that actively invests in global equity and fixed income markets, primarily for institutional and intermediary clients.

Best known for International Equities, Artio Global also offers a select group of other investment strategies, including High Grade Fixed Income, High Yield and Global Equity, as well as a series of US Equity strategies. Access to these strategies is offered through a variety of investment vehicles, including separate accounts, commingled funds and SEC-registered mutual funds.

Since 1995, our investment professionals have built a successful long-term track record by taking an unconventional approach to investing. Based on a philosophy of style-agnostic investing across a broad range of opportunities, we have consistently pursued a global approach that we believe provides critical insights, thereby adding value for clients over the long term.

For more information, please visit www.artioglobal.com.

Investor:Artio Global Investors Inc.Peter Sands, +1-212-297-3891Head of Investor Relationsir@artioglobal.comorMedia:Intermarket CommunicationsNeil Shapiro, +1-212-754-5423nshapiro@intermarket.com

entry.headline: Northern Trust Corporation to Present at the Goldman Sachs US Financial Services Conference on December 7th
entry.body:
Northern Trust Corporation to Present at the Goldman Sachs US Financial Services Conference on December 7th

Northern Trust Corporation announced today that Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Frederick H. Waddell will speak at the Goldman Sachs US Financial Services Conference 2010 on Tuesday, December 7, 2010 at 8:20 a.m. (ET) at the Goldman Sachs Conference Center in New York City.

The live audio webcast of the presentation and presentation slides can be accessed via Northern Trust’s website at www.northerntrust.com/presentations. A replay of the presentation webcast will be accessible until January 5, 2011.

About Northern Trust

Northern Trust Corporation (Nasdaq: NTRS) is a leading provider of investment management, asset and fund administration, banking solutions and fiduciary services for corporations, institutions and affluent individuals worldwide. Northern Trust, a financial holding company based in Chicago, has offices in 18 U.S. states and 16 international locations in North America, Europe, the Middle East and the Asia-Pacific region. As of September 30, 2010, Northern Trust had US$3.9 trillion in assets under custody, and US$657 billion in assets under investment management. For 120 years, Northern Trust has earned distinction as an industry leader in combining exceptional service and expertise with innovative products and technology. For more information, visit www.northerntrust.com.

entry.headline: LogMeIn to Present at Upcoming J.P. Morgan and Barclays Conferences
entry.body: WOBURN, Mass., Nov. 23, 2010 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- LogMeIn, Inc. (Nasdaq:LOGM), a provider of SaaS-based, remote-connectivity solutions, today announced that management will present to the investment community at the J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference in New York City on December 2, 2010 and at the Barclays Capital 2010 Global Technology Conference in San Francisco on December 8th, 2010. J.P. Morgan SMid Cap Conference Date: Thursday, December 2, 2010 Presentation Time: 10:15 a.m. ET Location: J.P. Morgan Conference Center, New York City, NY Presenters: Michael Simon and Jim Kelliher Barclays Capital 2010 Global Technology Conference Date: Wednesday, December 8, 2010 Presentation Time: 3:00 p.m. PT Location: Palace Hotel, San Francisco, CA Presenter: Michael Simon The presentations will be webcast and can be accessed from the Investor Relations section of the Company's corporate website at http://www.LogMeIn.com. About LogMeIn, Inc. LogMeIn (Nasdaq:LOGM) provides SaaS-based remote access, support and collaboration solutions to quickly, simply and securely connect millions of internet-enabled devices across the globe -- computers, smartphones, iPad(TM) tablets, digital displays, and even in-dash computers of the Ford F-150 pick-up truck. Designed for consumers, mobile professionals and IT organizations, LogMeIn's solutions empower over 10.4 million active users to connect more than 100 million devices. LogMeIn is based in Woburn, Massachusetts, USA, with offices in Australia, Hungary, the Netherlands, and the UK. LogMeIn is a registered trademark of LogMeIn in the U.S. and other countries. iPhone and iPad are trademarks of Apple, Inc., in the U.S. and other countries around the world. The LogMeIn, Inc. logo is available at http://www.globenewswire.com/newsroom/prs/?pkgid=6574 CONTACT: Blueshirt Group Investors Erica Abrams 415-217-5864 erica@blueshirtgroup.com Matthew Hunt 415-489-2194 matt@blueshirtgroup.com LogMeIn, Inc. Press Craig VerColen 781-897-0696 Press@LogMeIn.com

entry.headline: UPDATE 3-MOVES-Nikko Asset, JP Morgan, FTI Consulting, AIG
entry.body:
(Adds Wells Fargo)

Nov 23 (Reuters) - The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Tuesday. To inform us of other job changes, email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

AMERICAN INTERNATIONAL GROUP (AIG.N)

The company appointed Brian Schreiber as executive vice-president, treasury and capital markets. Schreiber joined AIG in 1997 as a portfolio manager in its Global Investment Group.

The company also named Robert Gender as senior vice-president and treasurer. Prior to joining AIG, Gender served as assistant vice-president in the treasury department of the Equitable Life Assurance Society, a division of the AXA Group.

WELLS FARGO

Wells Fargo (WFC.N) Advisors has hired an adviser from regional firm Hilliard Lyons overseeing $93 million of client assets. Thomas Barnes joined Wells Fargo in Louisville, Kentucky -- which is also Hilliard Lyons' home base -- Wells Fargo Advisors said on Tuesday.

NIKKO ASSET MANAGEMENT CO

The Japanese asset management company named Charlie Metcalfe as president of Nikko Asset Management Europe, to run the firm's business across Europe and the Middle East and to oversee US operations. Metcalfe was the chief executive of First State Investments.

J.P. MORGAN ASSET MANAGEMENT

The subsidiary of JP Morgan Chase Co (JPM.N) said Mark Riggall has joined its international sales team as head of strategic alliances. Riggall joins J.P. Morgan Asset Management from Jupiter Asset Management where he was an international sales manager.

FTI CONSULTING INC (FCN.N)

The business advisory firm said it appointed Aurelio Garcia-Miro as senior managing director for the FTI corporate finance/restructuring team in Madrid. Garcia-Miro was senior director and co-head of Alvarez Marsal Spain.

FTI also said it appointed Sergio Velez as managing director and Andreas Fluhrer as director of the team.

VTB CAPITAL PLC

The investment business of VTB Group named Judy Lim as chief executive for VTB Capital Plc, Singapore. Lim joined VTB Capital, Singapore in 2009 as head of global markets distribution, Asia.

RATHBONE BROTHERS PLC

The investment and wealth management services provider said it appointed Mark Nicholls to the board as of Dec. 1 as an independent non-executive director and chairman-designate.

OTKRITIE BANK

The Russian bank named Anton Klekovkin as its new head of corporate finance. Klekovkin was head of strategy and corporate development at E.ON Russia. (Compiled by Saqib Iqbal Ahmed and Krishnakali Sengupta in Bangalore)

entry.headline: En estas fiestas de fin de año Visa ofrece soluciones para compras internacionales por Internet para que los consumidores accedan a las marcas internacionales que ellos adoran
entry.body:
En estas fiestas de fin de año Visa ofrece soluciones para compras internacionales por Internet para que los consumidores accedan a las marcas internacionales que ellos adoran

Visa Inc. (NYSE:V) dio a conocer hoy una serie de promociones con dos servicios de compras por Internet: Borderlinx en 12 países de todo el mundo y SkyBOX en más de 40 países en Latinoamérica, servicios que facilitarán a los titulares de tarjetas Visa adquirir por Internet productos en los Estados Unidos durante estas fiestas de fin de año.

Borderlinx y SkyBOX son dos de los servicios para compras por comercio electrónico (eCommerce) más grandes del mundo para consumidores y comerciantes. Los titulares de tarjeta Visa en Australia, Bahrein, Canadá, China, Kuwait, Nueva Zelandia, Omán, Qatar, Rusia, Arabia Saudita y los Emiratos Árabes Unidos (EAU) ya pueden registrarse de forma gratuita en Borderlinx (www.borderlinx.visa.com) y disfrutar de las compras en miles de comercios en línea de los EE. UU. y el Reino Unido. A través de SkyBOX (www.skybox.net/visa), los titulares de tarjeta Visa de cualquier país de Latinoamérica o del Caribe también se pueden registrar gratuitamente y comprar en los comercios en línea de los EE. UU. Los servicios de Borderlinx y SkyBOX proporcionan a los clientes una dirección de envío personalizada en EE. UU. a la cual los comerciantes pueden enviar los productos que los clientes adquieran. Posteriormente, Borderlinx y SkyBOX disponen todo para que estos productos sean enviados al país de residencia del titular de la tarjeta.

Para promocionar estos servicios que permiten las compras en línea transfronterizas y proporcionar valor a los titulares de las tarjetas, Visa ha desarrollado ofertas exclusivas que incluyen sorteos, festivales de compras y descuentos. Para los bancos emisores de tarjetas, Visa pone a disposición plataformas personalizadas en áreas geográficas seleccionadas en todo el mundo, destinadas a ayudar a los emisores a promover y hacer crecer las ventas de comercio electrónico transfronterizo (los emisores pueden enviar un correo electrónico a internationalecommerce@visa.com para obtener información adicional).

Los titulares de tarjeta Visa que realicen sus compras a través de Borderlinx y SkyBOX disfrutarán de una rápida entrega y de precios competitivos. Además del registro gratuito, Borderlinx está ofreciendo un 10% de ahorros para los titulares de tarjeta Visa en países seleccionados durante los períodos de promoción. En Latinoamérica, SkyBOX ofrece un descuento de US$ 10 en el primer envío, además del registro gratuito. A los compradores se les recomienda ingresar tanto a www.borderlinx.visa.com como a www.skybox.net/visa, para conocer las ofertas específicas para cada país.

Gerry Sweeney, jefe internacional de comercio electrónico y autenticación de Visa Inc., expresó: “Uno de los inhibidores del crecimiento del comercio electrónico transfronterizo es la entrega de los productos. En muchos países, la compra de artículos en línea a comerciantes establecidos en los EE. UU. ha demostrado ser costosa y complicada desde el punto de vista logístico. Nos asociamos con proveedores de servicios logísticos como Borderlinx y SkyBOX para eliminar los obstáculos de las transacciones transfronterizas de comercio electrónico al permitir que los titulares de tarjeta Visa puedan comprar por Internet en miles de tiendas establecidas en los EE.UU., que normalmente no enviarían sus productos al extranjero”.

Sweeney agregó: “Visa reconoce que las compras por Internet están en constante evolución por la conducta cambiante de los consumidores y la aparición, disponibilidad y adopción de nuevas tecnologías. Seguiremos trabajando para encontrar maneras innovadoras de crear nuevos productos y servicios que aumenten el valor de la moneda digital”.

La alianza de Visa con Borderlinx y SkyBOX y la facilitación del envío de productos desde los EE. UU. son parte de los esfuerzos de comercio electrónico internacional de Visa para entregar una experiencia de compras en línea más satisfactoria para los consumidores, creando al mismo tiempo un entorno que permita ventas en línea más rentables para los comerciantes.

Los compradores pueden registrarse para el servicio Borderlinx en línea en (www.borderlinx.visa.com) y SkyBOX en (www.skybox.net/visa).

Acerca de Visa

Visa es una compañía mundial de tecnología de pago que conecta a los consumidores, comercios, instituciones financieras y gubernamentales en más de 200 países y territorios con una moneda digital confiable, segura y rápida. Esta moneda digital es respaldada por VisaNet, una de las redes de procesamiento más avanzadas del mundo, capaz de manejar más de 10.000 transacciones por segundo, con protección contra el fraude a los consumidores y que garantiza el pago a los comerciantes. Visa no es un banco y no emite tarjetas, no otorga créditos ni fija precios ni tarifas para los consumidores. Las innovaciones de Visa, no obstante, permiten que sus clientes de instituciones financieras ofrezcan a los consumidores más opciones: productos de pague ahora con débito, por anticipado con prepago o más tarde con crédito. Para obtener más información, visite www.corporate.visa.com.

El texto original en el idioma fuente de este comunicado es la versión oficial autorizada. Las traducciones solo se suministran como adaptación y deben cotejarse con el texto en el idioma fuente, que es la única versión del texto que tendrá un efecto legal.

Visa Inc.Paul Wilke, 415-881-7995globalmedia@visa.comoFleishman-HillardColleen Smith, 415-318-4183colleen.smith@fleishman.com

entry.headline: Visa oferece soluções internacionais de compra on-line durante as festas de fim de ano para que os consumidores tenham acesso às suas marcas globais preferidas
entry.body:
Visa oferece soluções internacionais de compra on-line durante as festas de fim de ano para que os consumidores tenham acesso às suas marcas globais preferidas

A Visa Inc. (NYSE:V) anunciou hoje uma série de promoções com dois serviços de compra on-line – Borderlinx, em doze países de todo o mundo, e SkyBOX, em mais de 40 países da América Latina – facilitando as compras de produtos dos Estados Unidos pela internet para os titulares de cartões Visa durante as festas de fim de ano.

Borderlinx e SkyBOX são dois dos principais serviços de eCommerce do mundo para consumidores e comerciantes. Os titulares de cartões Visa da Austrália, Bahrein, Canadá, China, Kuwait, Nova Zelândia, Omã, Qatar, Rússia, Arábia Saudita e Emirados Árabes Unidos podem agora inscrever-se no Borderlinx (www.borderlinx.visa.com) gratuitamente e fazer suas compras on-line em milhares de lojas dos EUA e Reino Unido. Através do SkyBOX (www.skybox.net/visa), os titulares de cartões Visa de qualquer país da América Latina e do Caribe também podem se registrar gratuitamente e fazer compras on-line em lojas dos EUA. Os serviços Borderlinx e SkyBOX oferecem aos consumidores um endereço de remessa personalizado nos EUA para onde os varejistas podem enviar os produtos adquiridos. Os serviços Borderlinx e SkyBOX se encarregam de enviar os produtos para o país de residência do titular do cartão.

Para promover esses serviços de compras on-line entre fronteiras e valorizar os titulares de cartões, a Visa desenvolveu ofertas exclusiva, incluindo sorteios, descontos e maratona de compras. Para os bancos emissores de cartões, a Visa está disponibilizando plataformas customizadas em regiões geográficas selecionadas em todo o mundo para ajudar os emissores a estimular e desenvolver as vendas de comércio eletrônico entre os países (os emissores podem enviar um e-mail para internationalecommerce@visa.com para receber mais informações).

Os titulares de cartões Visa que fizerem compras através dos serviços Borderlinx e SkyBOX desfrutarão de preços competitivos e entrega rápida. Além da inscrição gratuita, o Borderlink está oferecendo economia de 10% para os titulares de cartões Visa em determinados países durante períodos da promoção. Na América Latina, o SkyBOX está oferecendo um desconto de US$ 10 na primeira remessa, além de inscrição gratuita. Sugerimos aos consumidores acessar www.borderlinx.visa.com e www.skybox.net/visa, para ver as ofertas específicas de cada país.

Gerry Sweeney, chefe global de comércio eletrônico e autenticação da Visa Inc. afirmou: “Um inibidor do crescimento do comércio eletrônico entre os países é a entrega das mercadorias. Em vários países, fazer compras on-line de lojas do EUA é dispendioso e logisticamente complicado. Nós criamos parcerias com fornecedores de serviços de logística, como Borderlinx e SkyBOX, para remover os obstáculos às transações de comércio eletrônico entre fronteiras, habilitando os titulares de cartões internacionais Visa a fazerem compras on-line e comprar de milhares de lojas de varejo dos EUA, que normalmente não fariam remessas internacionais”.

Sweeney disse ainda que “a Visa reconhece que o comércio on-line está constantemente evoluindo para mudar o comportamento do consumidor e o advento, disponibilização e adoção de novas tecnologias. Continuaremos a trabalhar para encontrar formas inovadoras de criar novos produtos e serviços que aumentem o valor da moeda digital”.

A parceria da Visa com os serviços Borderlinx e SkyBOX e a facilitação das remessas dos produtos dos EUA fazem parte das iniciativas globais de comércio eletrônico da Visa para proporcionar uma experiência de compras on-line mais satisfatória para os consumidores, criando um ambiente que proporciona vendas on-line mais lucrativas para os lojistas.

Os consumidores podem inscrever-se on-line para o serviço Borderlinx no (www.borderlinx.visa.com) e SkyBOX no (www.skybox.net/visa).

Sobre a Visa

A Visa é uma empresa global de tecnologia de pagamentos que conecta consumidores, empresas, instituições financeiras e governos em mais de duzentos países e territórios a uma moeda digital confiável, segura e rápida. Apoiando a moeda digital, a VisaNet é uma das mais avançadas redes de processamento do mundo, capaz de lidar com mais de dez mil transações por segundo, com proteção contra fraude para os consumidores e pagamento garantido para os comerciantes. A Visa não é um banco, e não emite cartões, estende crédito ou estabelece taxas e índices para consumidores. As inovações da Visa, no entanto, permitem que seus clientes de instituições financeiras ofereçam aos consumidores um número maior de opções: pagar agora em débito, adiantadamente com cartão pré-pago ou, mais tarde, com produtos de crédito. Para mais informações, acesse www.corporate.visa.com.

O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. As traduções são fornecidas apenas como uma facilidade e devem se referir ao texto no idioma original, que é a única versão do texto que tem efeito legal.

Visa Inc.Paul Wilke, 415-881-7995globalmedia@visa.comouFleishman-HillardColleen Smith, 415-318-4183colleen.smith@fleishman.com

entry.headline: Visa offre des solutions internationales d`achat en ligne pour les fêtes de fin d`année qui permettront aux consommateurs d`avoir accès à leurs marques internationales préférées
entry.body:
Visa offre des solutions internationales d’achat en ligne pour les fêtes de fin d’année qui permettront aux consommateurs d’avoir accès à leurs marques internationales préférées

Visa Inc. (NYSE : V) a annoncé aujourd’hui une série de promotions avec deux services d’achat en ligne : Borderlinx dans 12 pays dans le monde et SkyBOX dans plus de 40 pays d’Amérique latine. Les titulaires d’une carte Visa pourront ainsi plus facilement acheter sur Internet des articles aux États-Unis pour les fêtes de fin d’année.

Borderlinx et SkyBOX sont deux services de facilitation de commerce électronique parmi les plus importants du monde pour les consommateurs et les commerçants. Les titulaires d’une carte Visa en Australie, à Bahreïn, au Canada, en Chine, au Koweït, en Nouvelle-Zélande, à Oman, au Qatar, en Russie, en Arabie saoudite et aux Émirats arabes unis peuvent s’inscrire dès à présent gratuitement sur Borderlinx (www.borderlinx.visa.com) et effectuer des achats dans des milliers de boutiques en ligne américaines et britanniques. Par le biais de SkyBOX (www.skybox.net/visa), les titulaires d’une carte Visa dans les pays d’Amérique latine ou aux Caraïbes peuvent aussi s’inscrire gratuitement et faire des achats dans des boutiques en ligne américaines. Les services Borderlinx et SkyBOX fournissent aux acheteurs une adresse d’expédition personnalisée aux États-Unis à laquelle les détaillants peuvent envoyer les articles achetés. Borderlinx et SkyBOX organisent ensuite la livraison de ces articles dans le pays du titulaire de la carte.

Pour promouvoir ces services de facilitation d’achats en ligne transfrontaliers en ajoutant de la valeur pour les titulaires de carte, Visa a mis au point des offres exclusives dont des tirages au sort, des opérations « panier gratuit » et des remises. Visa met à la disposition des banques émettrices de cartes des plateformes personnalisées dans des pays sélectionnés afin d’aider les émetteurs à promouvoir et développer les ventes transfrontalières de commerce électronique (les émetteurs peuvent envoyer un courrier électronique à internationalecommerce@visa.com pour demander de plus amples informations).

Les titulaires de carte Visa qui achèteront par le biais de Borderlinx ou de SkyBOX bénéficieront d’une livraison rapide et de prix compétitifs. En plus de l’inscription gratuite, Borderlinx offre une remise de 10 % aux titulaires d’une carte Visa dans certains pays pendant des périodes promotionnelles. En Amérique latine, SkyBOX offre aux titulaires d’une carte Visa une remise de 10 USD sur la première livraison en plus de l’inscription gratuite. Les acheteurs sont invités à prendre connaissance des offres particulières par pays sur www.borderlinx.visa.com et www.skybox.net/visa.

Gerry Sweeney, directeur international du commerce électronique et de l’authentification de Visa Inc., a déclaré : « La livraison des marchandises constitue l’un des principaux freins à la croissance du commerce électronique transfrontalier. Dans de nombreux pays, acheter chez un commerçant en ligne situé aux États-Unis s’avère coûteux et complexe sur le plan logistique. Nous nous associons à des prestataires de services logistiques comme Borderlinx et SkyBOX pour supprimer les obstacles aux transactions transfrontalières de commerce électronique en facilitant, pour les détenteurs de carte Visa hors des États-Unis, l’achat en ligne auprès de milliers de boutiques de détail situées aux États-Unis et qui n’assurent pas normalement la livraison hors des États-Unis ».

Gerry Sweeney a ajouté : « Visa est conscient que l’achat en ligne évolue constamment en raison du changement du comportement du consommateur et de l’apparition, de la disponibilité et de l’adoption de nouvelles technologies. Nous continuerons de travailler pour trouver des solutions innovantes afin de créer des produits et services nouveaux, ajoutant de la valeur à la monnaie numérique ».

Le partenariat de Visa avec Borderlinx et SkyBOX et la facilitation des livraisons de produits au départ des États-Unis font partie des efforts de commerce électronique de Visa dans le monde entier visant à fournir aux consommateurs une expérience plus satisfaisante de l’achat en ligne tout en créant pour les commerçants un environnement capable d’assurer des ventes en ligne plus rentables.

Les acheteurs peuvent s’inscrire en ligne au service de Borderlinx (www.borderlinx.visa.com) et de SkyBOX (www.skybox.net/visa).

À propos de Visa

Visa est une société internationale de technologie de paiement qui connecte des consommateurs, des entreprises, des institutions financières et des gouvernements de plus de 200 pays et territoires à de la monnaie numérique rapide, sécurisée et fiable. À la base de la monnaie numérique se trouve l’un des réseaux de traitement les plus perfectionnés du monde, VisaNet. Ce dernier peut traiter plus de 10 000 transactions à la seconde, tout en protégeant les consommateurs contre la fraude et en garantissant le paiement aux commerçants. Visa n’est pas une banque, n’émet pas de carte, n’octroie pas de crédit et ne fixe aucun taux, aucune commission applicable aux consommateurs. Les innovations de Visa permettent toutefois à ses institutions financières clientes d’offrir un plus grand choix aux consommateurs : paiement immédiat avec carte de débit, paiement en avance avec carte prépayée ou paiement différé grâce au crédit. Pour de plus amples informations, consultez www.corporate.visa.com.

Le texte du communiqué issu d’une traduction ne doit d’aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d’origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence.

Visa Inc.Paul Wilke, 415-881-7995globalmedia@visa.comouFleishman-HillardColleen Smith, 415-318-4183colleen.smith@fleishman.com

entry.headline: Fitch Rates J.P. Morgan Securities Inc. PUTTERs & DRIVERs, Series 3835 & 3842
entry.body:
Fitch Rates J.P. Morgan Securities Inc. PUTTERs DRIVERs, Series 3835 3842

Fitch Ratings assigns ratings of 'AAA/F1+' to the J.P. Morgan Securities Inc. puttable tax-exempt receipts (PUTTERs), series 3835 and 3842 and ratings of 'AAA' to the derivative inverse tax-exempt receipts (DRIVERs), series 3835 and 3842.

The long-term ratings assigned to the PUTTERs and the ratings assigned to the DRIVERs are based on the rating Fitch has assigned to the Chicago Park District, Illinois, general obligation unlimited tax bonds (harbor facilities revenues alternate revenue source), series 2010C (rated 'AAA' with a Stable Outlook), deposited in the J.P. Morgan PUTTERs/DRIVERs Series 3835 and 3842 Trusts.

The short-term 'F1+' rating assigned to the PUTTERs is based on the liquidity facility for each series provided by JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. The 'F1+' rating will expire on Nov. 22, 2011, the expiration date of each series liquidity facility, unless such date is extended or earlier terminated.

Additional information is available at 'www.fitchratings.com'.

Applicable Criteria and Related Research:

--'U.S. Municipal Structured Finance Rating Criteria', dated Aug. 16, 2010;

--'Guidelines for Rating Secondary Market Synthetic Floating-Rate Securities', dated Nov. 25, 2008.

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Accent Computer Solutions Has Been Accepted Into Microsoft's Exclusive US Cloud Champions Club and VAR Champions Club
entry.body: RANCHO CUCAMONGA, CA, Nov 23 (MARKET WIRE) -- Accent Computer Solutions, a leading Southern California IT firm specializing in IT service and support for small to medium-sized businesses, has been selected to be a member of two exclusive Microsoft clubs. The US Cloud Champions Club is an exclusive club that is only open to Microsoft Partners who demonstrate a commitment to "the cloud." Membership includes enhanced training and resources, engagement from an Online Services Partner Development Manager, and enhanced operations support from Microsoft's team. The US VAR Champions Club is designed to recognize and reward Microsoft Partners for their impact in the marketplace, and deliver value in terms of engagement to help their businesses thrive. This program is only open to Microsoft Partners who meet specific revenue and growth criteria. "We're very excited to be a member of both of these exclusive clubs. The added resources and engagement from Microsoft's team will help us to grow our business and deliver more value to our customers. We're honored to have been selected as one of the few Partners who qualify for this opportunity," said Accent Computer Solutions' president, Marty Kaufman. About Accent Computer Solutions, Inc. Founded in 1987, Accent Computer Solutions, Inc. (www.bestcomputerserviceandsupport.com) is a leading information technology solution provider serving a wide spectrum of businesses and organizations. Accent caters to the needs of small to medium-sized businesses, as well as to multi-office, multi-location enterprises. Accent's focus is on reducing the cost and the risk of Information Technology by providing proactive IT services and support, IT outsourcing, network management, managed IT services, network services, business telephone/VoIP, new building and remodel cabling, and wireless solutions. Accent is headquartered in Rancho Cucamonga and has branch offices in Riverside, Orange County, and Los Angeles. Accent has been ranked #1 by The Business Press in its 2007, 2008, and 2010 Book of Lists. Contact Info: Courtney Kaufman 8438 Red Oak Street Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730 (909) 481-4368 Office (909) 481-4376 Fax CourtneyK@TeamAccent.com Copyright 2010, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Visa bietet diese Weihnachten internationale Online-Shoppinglösungen um Verbrauchern Zugang zu geliebten Marken von Weltrang zu ermöglichen
entry.body:
Visa bietet diese Weihnachten internationale Online-Shoppinglösungen um Verbrauchern Zugang zu geliebten Marken von Weltrang zu ermöglichen

Visa Inc. (NYSE:V) hat heute eine Reihe von Aktionen mit zwei Online-Shoppingdiensten angekündigt – Borderlinx in 12 Ländern weltweit und SkyBOX in über 40 Ländern in Lateinamerika – dank denen Visa-Karteninhaber in der Vorweihnachtszeit einfacher über das Internet Waren aus den USA einkaufen können.

Borderlinx und SkyBOX sind zwei der weltweit führenden E-Commerce-Dienste, die für Verbraucher und Händler den Einkauf im Internet ermöglichen. Visa-Karteninhaber aus Australien, Bahrain, China, Kanada, Katar, Kuwait, Neuseeland, Oman, Russland, Saudi-Arabien und den VAE können sich nun kostenlos bei Borderlinx (www.borderlinx.visa.com) anmelden und so bei Tausenden von Online-Händlern aus den USA und Großbritannien einkaufen. Über SkyBOX (www.skybox.net/visa) können sich auch Visa-Karteninhaber aus allen Staaten Lateinamerikas und der Karibik kostenlos anmelden und bei Online-Händlern aus den USA einkaufen. Sowohl Borderlinx als auch SkyBOX stellen den Käufern eine persönliche Lieferadresse in den USA zur Verfügung, wo die Händler die bestellten Waren anliefern können. Borderlinx und SkyBOX sorgen dann dafür, dass die Waren anschließend ins Heimatland des Karteninhabers geliefert werden.

Um diese grenzübergreifenden Online-Shoppingdienste zu bewerben und den Karteninhabern einen Nutzen zu bieten, hat Visa exklusive Angebote wie Verlosungen, Einkaufstouren und Rabatte ausgearbeitet. Für kartenausstellende Banken stellt Visa in ausgewählten Weltgegenden kundenspezifische Plattformen zur Verfügung, durch die die Aussteller den grenzübergreifenden E-Commerce-Handel fördern und ankurbeln können (Aussteller wenden sich bitte per E-Mail an internationalecommerce@visa.com für weitere Informationen).

Visa-Karteninhaber, die über Borderlinx und SkyBOX einkaufen, kommen in den Genuss von kurzen Lieferzeiten und wettbewerbsfähigen Preisen. Zusätzlich zur kostenlosen Anmeldung offeriert Borderlinx während des Aktionszeitraums den Visa-Karteninhabern aus ausgewählten Ländern einen Rabatt von 10 Prozent. In Lateinamerika bietet SkyBOX einen Nachlass von 10 US-Dollar auf die erste Lieferung, und die Anmeldung ist ebenfalls kostenlos. Käufer werden gebeten, sowohl www.borderlinx.visa.com als auch www.skybox.net/visa nach länderspezifischen Angeboten zu prüfen.

Gerry Sweeney, globaler Leiter für E-Commerce und Authentifizierung bei Visa Inc., sagte: „Ein Hindernis für das Wachstum des grenzübergreifenden E-Commerce ist die Warenanlieferung. In vielen Ländern hat sich der Einkauf bei Online-Händlern aus den USA als teuer und logistisch kompliziert erwiesen. Wir verbünden uns mit Anbietern von Logistikdienstleistungen wie Borderlinx und SkyBOX, um diese Hindernisse bei grenzübergreifenden E-Commerce-Transaktionen aus dem Weg zu räumen und internationalen Visa-Karteninhabern den Online-Einkauf bei Tausenden von US-amerikanischen Händlern und Geschäften zu ermöglichen, die normalerweise keine Waren ins Ausland liefern.“

Sweeney weiter: „Visa hat erkannt, dass sich Online-Einkäufe aufgrund wechselnder Verhaltensweisen seitens der Verbraucher und der Einführung, Verfügbarkeit und Übernahme neuer Technologien stetig weiterentwickeln. Wir werden weiterhin daran arbeiten, innovative Möglichkeiten zum Aufbau neuer Produkte und Dienstleistungen zu finden, die den Wert der digitalen Währung steigern.“

Die Partnerschaft zwischen Visa und Borderlinx sowie SkyBOX und die Erleichterung von Warenlieferungen aus den USA sind Bestandteile der globalen E-Commerce-Maßnahmen von Visa um ein noch mehr zufriedenstellendes Online-Shoppingerlebnis für Verbraucher zu bieten und gleichzeitig ein Umfeld zu kreieren, das die Online-Verkäufe für Händler gewinnbringender macht.

Einkäufer können sich für die Dienstleistungen von Borderlinx (www.borderlinx.visa.com) und SkyBOX (www.skybox.net/visa) online anmelden.

Über Visa

Visa ist ein im Zahlungsverkehr tätiges globales Technologieunternehmen, das Verbrauchern, Geschäften, Finanzinstituten und Behörden in über 200 Ländern und Territorien schnell, sicher und zuverlässig Zugang zu elektronischer Währung gibt. Untermauert wird dieser Zugang durch VisaNet, eines der fortschrittlichsten Verarbeitungsnetzwerke der Welt. VisaNet kann über 10.000 Transaktionen pro Sekunde bewältigen, schützt Verbraucher vor Betrugsfällen und garantiert Händlern den Zahlungseingang. Visa ist keine Bank, stellt keine Karten aus, gewährt keine Verlängerungen der Zahlungsfrist und legt auch keine Tarife und Gebühren für Verbraucher fest. Die Innovationen von Visa machen es jedoch möglich, dass Finanzinstitute Verbrauchern eine größere Auswahl bieten können: Zahlungen in Echtzeit mit Debit-, im Voraus mit Prepaid- oder im Nachhinein mit Kreditprodukten. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.corporate.visa.com.

Die Ausgangssprache, in der der Originaltext veröffentlicht wird, ist die offizielle und autorisierte Version. Übersetzungen werden zur besseren Verständigung mitgeliefert. Nur die Sprachversion, die im Original veröffentlicht wurde, ist rechtsgültig. Gleichen Sie deshalb Übersetzungen mit der originalen Sprachversion der Veröffentlichung ab.

Visa Inc.Paul Wilke, 415-881-7995globalmedia@visa.comoderFleishman-HillardColleen Smith, 415-318-4183colleen.smith@fleishman.com

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Walton Ontario Land L.P. 1 Reports Third Quarter 2010 Results
entry.body:
Walton Ontario Land L.P. 1 Reports Third Quarter 2010 Results

Walton International Group Inc. and Walton Ontario Land L. P. 1 (the “Partnership”) announced today the Partnership’s results for the third quarter ended September 30, 20101.

BUSINESS OVERVIEW

The Partnership was established on October 2, 2009 for the purpose of maximizing returns to its limited partners through the acquisition, management, concept planning and eventual sale of two properties consisting of an aggregate of 455 acres of undeveloped land in southern Ontario (the “Properties”). The land located near the Toronto area in Alliston, Ontario consists of two parcels of land comprised of 155 acres. The land located in the southwest quadrant of the City of Ottawa (the “Ottawa Property”) consists of a single parcel of 300 acres. The Partnership is managed by Walton International Group Inc. (“WIGI”).

It is the current intention of the Partnership to hold its interest in the Properties as an investment and to eventually dispose of its interest prior to physical development of the Properties. If the partners determine that the Partnership should participate in the development of the Properties (other than pre-development concept planning), the activities of the Partnership may also include the partial or full development of the Properties prior to the sale of the Properties.

RESULTS OF OPERATIONS AND PERFORMANCE

Having completed the initial public offering (“IPO”) in the first quarter of 2010, and both the private placement offering (“Private Placement”) and the land acquisition in the second quarter of 2010, the Partnership has begun to execute the concept planning phase of the overall investment strategy during the third quarter. As outlined in the offering documents, during the concept planning phase now underway, engineering, planning and legal professionals prepare the land for development by obtaining municipal approvals. In order to obtain such approvals, the Partnership will work with regional and municipal planning authorities to conceptually plan the Properties for build-out in order to achieve the highest and best development potential. These approvals generally will attract an expanded audience of potential buyers.

As described in the Partnership’s original offering documents, net income, if any, earned from the Properties prior to their eventual sale was not and is not anticipated to be significant. To address this, the Partnership initially provided for reserves to self-fund the costs relating to the Properties. Purchasers of Partnership units will not receive a significant amount of income or cash, if any, distributed on their investment in the units until such time as any of the Properties are sold.

Expenses for the period are in line with those anticipated in the Partnership’s original plans. Total costs incurred and capitalized by the Partnership relating to concept planning for the three months ended September 30, 2010 were $30,627, of which $27,843 consists of third-party consulting costs and $2,784 consists of fees to Walton Development and Management Inc. This $30,267 represents the first concept planning costs incurred out of the total reserves of $787,253 set aside for concept planning over the life of the project. Concept planning costs are capitalized as land improvement, and form part of the total land costs to date.

The Partnership is proceeding as anticipated and as described in the offering documents and in line with the Partnership’s plan to acquire and hold interests in the Properties for appreciation in value.

SUMMARY OF THIRD QUARTER RESULTS

The following table provides a summary of key financial information for the period:

    Three months ended

Sept 30, 2010

  Nine months ended

Sept 30, 2010

Total Revenue ($)   17,575   50,312 Total Expenses ($)   232,954   902,297 Net loss and comprehensive loss ($)   215,379   851,985 Units issued under the IPO/Private Placement   0   3,580,000 Basic net loss per unit ($)   0.06   0.39    

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

The Partnership's quarterly financial statements, management’s discussion and analysis, and other information about the Partnership have been filed on SEDAR and are available at www.sedar.com.

* * * * *

The Partnership is managed by Walton International Group Inc., part of the Walton Group of Companies. Walton seeks to acquire and syndicate undeveloped land that is strategically located in the path of major North American urban growth corridors. These lands are syndicated to investors, without the use of leverage, made development-ready through concept planning, and then sold for a profit when it is commercially opportune to do so. In business for over 30 years, the Walton Group currently manages over $2.7 billion of real estate assets, including over 55,000 acres of land, on behalf of itself and investors and clients in North America, Europe and Asia. To date, Walton has syndicated over 300 projects across North America. Of these, 40 projects have been fully or partially completed, providing returns to investors from the profit made on the sale of the lands.

For more information about Walton, please visit www.waltoninternational.com

This news release, required by Canadian laws, does not constitute an offer of securities, and is not for distribution or dissemination outside Canada. Offerings of these securities were only made by prospectus or offering memorandum, only to Canadian residents, and only as permitted by law. The risks, uncertainties and other factors that could influence results are described in the prospectus and other documents filed with Canadian securities regulatory authorities and available online at www.sedar.com.

1 All amounts are in Canadian dollars, and are based on unaudited interim financial statements for the quarter ended September 30, 2010, and related notes, prepared in accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles (“GAAP”).

For media inquiries, please contact Rita Mezzanotte:Office: 1-647-826-1356Cell: 1-647-308-5549Email: rmezzanotte@waltonglobal.com

entry.headline: Literacy Bridge Founder Receives Microsoft Alumni Foundation Award from Bill and Melinda Gates
entry.body:
Literacy Bridge Founder Receives Microsoft Alumni Foundation Award from Bill and Melinda Gates

Seattle non-profit also announces preliminary results from its Talking Book program, to be presented at the ICTD 2010 conference in London

Today Literacy Bridge announced that its founder, Cliff Schmidt, was presented with the Microsoft Alumni Foundation Integral Fellows award by Bill and Melinda Gates. The panel of judges selecting Mr. Schmidt included Tom Brokaw, journalist and author; Bill Drayton, chair and CEO, Ashoka; William H. Gates Sr., co-chair, Bill Melinda Gates Foundation; Pierre Omidyar, founding partner, Omidyar Network and founder and chairman, eBay Inc.; Judith Rodin, president, Rockefeller Foundation; and Thomas J. Tierney, chairman and co-founder, Bridgespan Group. Criteria in selecting the winners included the ability to create something extraordinary out of limited resources; selflessness; passion; smarts; need; and scalability. The award includes an unrestricted $25,000 grant and access to the talents and skills of Microsoft alumni to help support Literacy Bridge’s ongoing efforts.

“It is an honor to be recognized by my peers, the Microsoft Alumni,” said Cliff Schmidt, founder of Literacy Bridge. “The results from our Talking Book project are very encouraging, and receiving recognition from Bill and Melinda Gates is incredibly rewarding. The Microsoft Alumni Foundation award will help us expand Literacy Bridge’s Talking Book project into new communities.”

Literacy Bridge improves the health, education, and income of impoverished rural families through an innovative audio computer that provides easy access to on-demand, locally relevant, practical information. Just as the rest of the world has the convenience of a local library or the Web, the “Talking Book” delivers an audio library of critical knowledge to those who need it most—people who cannot read and live in extreme poverty.

Literacy Bridge’s partnerships with local experts in health, agriculture and education ensure that Talking Book messages are relevant and actionable. For example, mothers learn how to recognize the symptoms of TB or malaria; subsistence farmers learn about optimal seed spacing and use of manure for crop production; children and illiterate adults practice their reading by playing books at the speed they choose, and test their vocabulary and reading comprehension with audio hyperlinks and multiple-choice quizzes.

Literacy Bridge has also been invited to present the results of its Talking Book program evaluation study at the International Conference on Information and Communication Technologies and Development (ICTD 2010) in London, December 13-16, 2010. Highlights include:

91% of residents using Talking Books applied a new health or agriculture practice based on Talking Book lessons. In a year when their peers saw a 5% drop in crop production, farmers using Talking Books saw an average increase of 48%. After controlling for a variety of other factors, use of a Talking Book correlated with an increased production of 2.75 bags of crops per farm, valued at $89. These additional crops were worth $3000 all together, while the program investment is only $1000— a 3x return on investment in one year.

About Literacy Bridge

Literacy Bridge is a nonprofit organization established in 2007 to improve the health, education and income of impoverished rural families through knowledge. To serve this mission, the organization has developed the Talking Book, an innovative, low-cost, digital audio computer for people to build their literacy skills and for those who are illiterate to gain access to locally relevant information so that they can learn new practices to better their lives. Literacy Bridge partners with local governments, businesses, and nonprofits to develop and distribute such content. For more information please visit http://literacybridge.org/

Literacy BridgeForrest Carman206-859-3118forrest@literacybridge.org

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Research and Markets: Computer Manufacture: Industry Includes About 1,200, Including Dell, Hewlett-Packard, and IBM Companies with Combined Annual Revenue of About $75 Billion
entry.body:
Research and Markets: Computer Manufacture: Industry Includes About 1,200, Including Dell, Hewlett-Packard, and IBM Companies with Combined Annual Revenue of About $75 Billion

Research and Markets (http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/06b654/computer_manufactu) has announced the addition of the "Computer Manufacture " report to their offering.

First Research is the leading industry intelligence company that helps sales teams perform faster and smarter, open doors, and close more deals. First Research performs the "heavy lifting" by synthesizing hundreds of sources into an easy to digest format that a sales person can consume very quickly to better understand a prospect's business issues.

Executive Summary

Brief Excerpt from Industry Overview Chapter:

The US computer manufacturing industry includes about 1,200 companies with combined annual revenue of about $75 billion. Major companies include Dell, Hewlett-Packard, and IBM. The industry is highly concentrated: the top 50 companies generate about 90 percent of revenue.

COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE

Demand is tied to consumer and business income. The profitability of individual computer companies depends on purchasing and production efficiencies, and on technological expertise. Large companies have economies of scale in purchasing and production. Small companies can compete successfully by specializing in certain products or by developing superior technology. The industry is capital-intensive: annual revenue per employee is about $400,000.

PRODUCTS, OPERATIONS TECHNOLOGY

Major products include PCs, printers, monitors, mainframes, servers, and disk drives. Personal computers, mainframes, and servers account for 65 percent of industry revenue. Input/output devices (including monitors, printers, keyboards, and mice) make up 20 percent of revenue; storage devices, about 10 percent.

The manufacturing process for PCs consists of integrating circuit boards, disk drives, and input/output devices into a final product. Companies typically assemble PCs from components bought from other manufacturers. Key components like "motherboards" are specially made for a particular product, while disk drives and other components may be off-the-shelf parts. Despite automation gains, some assembly work is still labor-intensive. Manufacturers of specialized devices like printers, monitors, and disk drives may also buy some components from outside vendors. The manufacture of some products requires highly sophisticated machinery.

Key Topics Covered:

Industry Overview Quarterly Industry Update Business Challenges Trends AND Opportunities Call Preparation Questions Financial Information Industry Forecast Website and Media Links Glossary of Acronyms

entry.headline: Santa in Tropical Attire? Elves Tucking Kids Into Bed? It's All at the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Resort
entry.body: LAKE BUENA VISTA, FL, Nov 23 (MARKET WIRE) -- Holiday travelers may not know this but Santa Claus goes on a Florida vacation prior to his big night. This holiday season, guests can visit with Santa as he relaxes at the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Hotel. For the first time, he is bringing along Mrs. Claus to Santa's favorite Orlando hotel for some fun in the sun before the holidays. He and the Missus will be decked out in their tropical attire (no red suits with fur trim here!) sunning and lounging the day away. Everybody knows Santa is not at all camera shy, so he and Mrs. Claus are taking complimentary photos with guests at his customized Tiki hut throughout his stay. From being tucked into bed by an elf (yes, an elf!), to ordering a Christmas tree from room service, the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Hotel knows how to create a holiday celebration guests will never forget. It all starts after Thanksgiving when holiday festivities take place throughout this Epcot Resort hotel, turning it in to a winter wonderland right in sunny Orlando. Life-Size Chocolate Santa Santa may be known as sweet, but he even won't be able to match the sweetness of his likeness that will be on display throughout December in the lobby of the Swan. The hotel's executive pastry chef Laurent Branlard has created a life-sized sculpture of Santa, constructed entirely of chocolate -- approximately 1,200 lbs. of it! The sculpture also features a fireplace and Christmas tree. Branlard is the only two-time world pastry champion and renowned for his chocolate and sugar sculptures. Holiday Tree Guest Room Delivery Want to spruce up your room? Seriously. Guests can order a Christmas tree through room service and have it delivered right to their room. The 4-ft. tall, pre-lit trees include a commemorative hotel ornament. Bedtime Elf Tuck-ins While Santa is out delivering presents on Christmas Eve, his elves are tucking in children staying at the hotel. The elves bring milk and cookies, read a bedtime story and then tuck the children into bed just in time before Santa arrives! Reservations are required and space is limited for this exclusive Christmas Eve service offered from 6-9 p.m. For more details about all the holiday excitement at the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Hotel or to make room reservations, please visit www.santasfavoriteresort.com or call 1-800-227-1500. Contact: Joel Kaiman joel@tjmcommunications.com Treva J. Marshall treva@tjmcommunications.com TJM Communications, Inc. (407) 977-5004 Copyright 2010, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Zacks' Voice of the People highlights opportunities with Goldman Sachs Group, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America Corp., and Wells Fargo & Co.
entry.body:
Zacks' Voice of the People highlights opportunities with Goldman Sachs Group, Morgan Stanley, Bank of America Corp., and Wells Fargo Co.

Zacks highlights commentary from People and Picks Trader “inthemoneystocks”.

For more Voice of the People, visit http://at.zacks.com/?id=5851

Featured Post

Ireland Bailout Done, Who Is Next?

November 22, 2010 - RELATED TICKERS: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. (NYSE: GS), Morgan Stanley (NYSE: MS), Bank of America Corp. (NYSE: BAC) and Wells Fargo Co. (NYSE: WFC).

This morning Ireland is expected to accept a bailout from the European Central Bank (ECB) and the International Monetary Fund. However, there is still a lot of uncertainty regarding which nation in the European Union will need a bailout next. At this time Portugal is the one country that looks as if would be the next bailout candidate.

It is important to remember that in May 2010 the ECB did a $1 trillion European bank bailout that was similar to the Toxic Asset Relief Program (TARP) in the United States. However, as we can see this bailout by the ECB did not last that long. Spain and Italy are also being mentioned as candidates for a bailout in the not so distant future.

When the European Union begins to experience problems many major institutions will run or move money into the U.S. Dollar Index and flee other foreign currencies. Therefore, when the U.S. Dollar Index trades higher the stock markets will deflate or trade lower.

Please remember that most commodities are traded in U.S. Dollars and commodities are usually the first asset class to deflate and trade lower. Should the U.S. Dollar Index decline intra-day or pullback the stock market should bounce higher or even rally if the U.S. Dollar Index really declined sharply.

Goldman Sachs Group Inc. (NYSE: GS) is declining sharply this morning. The stock is trading lower by over $5.50 to $161.15. When this stock struggles or declines most other financial stocks will remain weak. Morgan Stanley (NYSE: MS) is also trading lower by 0.66 cents to $24.96. The large major bank stocks such as Bank of America Corp. (NYSE: BAC) and Wells Fargo Co. (NYSE: WFC) are trading slightly lower on the session.

Mondays are usually a light volume trading session that have favored the upside over the past year. Often companies will announced mergers, acquisitions and stock buybacks on a Monday. This action usually helps to keep the markets positive to begin the week.

However, should the news out of Europe become worse and another nation in the Euro-zone say they need a bailout the markets could decline. Keep one eye on the U.S. Dollar Index at all times as the major stock indexes will trade inverse to the dollar.

entry.headline: Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: ExxonMobil, BP Plc, Royal Dutch Shell, Hess Corp. and Petrobras
entry.body:
Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: ExxonMobil, BP Plc, Royal Dutch Shell, Hess Corp. and Petrobras

http://www.zacks.com/

Zacks.com Analyst Blog features: ExxonMobil Corporation (NYSE: XOM), BP Plc (NYSE: BP), Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE: RDS.A), Hess Corp. (NYSE: HES) and Petrobras (NYSE: PBR).

Get the most recent insight from Zacks Equity Research with the free Profit from the Pros newsletter: http://at.zacks.com/?id=4579

Here are highlights from Monday’s Analyst Blog:

Exxon’s Asset Disposal Program

According to a report by Sunday Times, oil major ExxonMobil Corporation (NYSE: XOM) intends to dispose of its North Sea assets worth $2 billion, including its vast Beryl field, to focus more on other fast growing areas such as Brazil. The company declined to comment on the report, but confirmed that it plans to divest 100 petrol stations in Scotland.

Regarding the North Sea divestiture plan, Exxon’s spokesman pointed out that the company intends to continue as a major investor in the North Sea region.

In recent years, major oil companies such as BP Plc (NYSE: BP), Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE: RDS.A), as well as Exxon are divesting their assets in the region, in order to focus on the areas such as Angola and the Gulf of Mexico (GoM). In September 2010, Exxon and Shell had planned to sell their interest in the Corvette field platform in the North Sea. Although the companies are not willing to completely remove their footprints from the area, the domain is expected to be occupied by smaller independent explorers.

Recently, Exxon and Hess Corp. (NYSE: HES) started drilling the third well in an offshore Brazil Block, BM-S-22, situated in Santos Basin. Each of the companies hold a 40% interest, while Petroleo Brasileiro SA or Petrobras (NYSE: PBR), Brazil’s state-controlled oil company, owns the remainder. Hence, this is reflective of the companies’ growing focus on Brazil.

The growth outlook of Exxon is more upbeat on the back of solid access to unconventional resources as the entire business of XTO Energy is now on its board. However, as access to new energy resources is becoming more difficult, ExxonMobil, like most of its peers, is facing headwinds to replace its reserve. It remains to be seen how the companies will develop the Brazilian deepwater.

We are currently maintaining our long-term Neutral recommendation for the Exxon stock. The company holds a Zacks #3 Rank (short-term Hold rating).

entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company Announces Results to Date of Cash Tender Offers
entry.body:
The Coca-Cola Company Announces Results to Date of Cash Tender Offers

The Coca-Cola Company ("TCCC" or the "Company") today announced that approximately $1.85 billion in aggregate principal amount of notes were tendered prior to 5:00 p.m., EST, on Monday, November 22, 2010—the Any and All Offer expiration date—pursuant to its previously announced cash tender offer for any and all of the 7.125% Debentures due August 1, 2017, 4.500% Notes due August 15, 2019, Zero Coupon Notes due June 20, 2020, 8.500% Debentures due February 1, 2022, 8.000% Debentures due September 15, 2022, 6.750% Debentures due September 15, 2023, 7.000% Debentures due October 1, 2026, 6.950% Debentures due November 15, 2026, 6.750% Debentures due September 15, 2028, 6.700% Debentures due October 15, 2036, 6.750% Debentures due January 15, 2038 and 7.000% Debentures due May 15, 2098 issued by the Company's wholly-owned subsidiary, Coca-Cola Refreshments USA, Inc. ("CCR"), and the 7.375% Notes due July 29, 2093 issued by the Company.

In the Any and All Offer, according to information provided by D. F. King Co., Inc., the tender agent for the offers, $1.85 billion in aggregate principal amount of notes were validly tendered and not validly withdrawn prior to the expiration of the offer at 5:00 p.m., EST, on November 22, 2010 as more fully set forth below. The Company has accepted for payment all notes validly tendered and not validly withdrawn in the Any and All Offer and expects to make payment for the notes in same-day funds today.

The Company has set the maximum principal amount of notes to be purchased pursuant to the Maximum Tender Offer as $1,601,783,000. Such maximum amount is equal to the difference between US$3,450,000,000 and the aggregate principal amount of notes validly tendered and accepted for payment in the Any and All Offer. The amounts of each series of notes to be purchased in the Maximum Tender Offer are prioritized and may be prorated as set forth in the Offer to Purchase, as supplemented on November 16, 2010.

The Maximum Tender Offer is scheduled to expire at 11:59 p.m., EST, on December 14, 2010, unless extended or earlier terminated. Holders of notes subject to the Maximum Tender Offer must tender and not withdraw their notes before the early tender date, which is 5:00 p.m., EST, on November 30, 2010, unless extended, to be eligible to receive the total consideration. Holders of notes subject to the Maximum Tender Offer who tender their notes after the early tender date will be eligible to receive the tender offer consideration, which is the total consideration minus $30 per $1,000 principal amount of notes tendered by such holder that are accepted for purchase. Holders of notes subject to the Maximum Tender Offer who tender their notes after the early tender date may not withdraw their notes except in the limited circumstances described fully in the Offer to Purchase.

The total consideration for each $1,000 principal amount of notes tendered and accepted for payment pursuant to the Maximum Tender Offer will be determined in the manner described in the Offer to Purchase by reference to a fixed spread specified for each series of the notes over the yield based on the bid side price of the U.S. Treasury Security specified on the cover page of the Offer to Purchase, as calculated by the dealer managers at 2:00 p.m., EST, on November 30, 2010. In addition to the total consideration or the tender offer consideration, as applicable, accrued interest up to, but not including, the settlement date will be paid in cash on all validly tendered notes accepted in the Maximum Tender Offer. The settlement date for the Maximum Tender Offer is currently expected to be Wednesday, December 15, 2010.

The Company has retained Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. and HSBC Securities (USA) Inc. to serve as coordinating dealer managers and Goldman, Sachs Co. and BofA Merrill Lynch to serve as dealer managers and D.F. King Co., Inc. to serve as the tender and information agent for the tender offers.

Requests for documents may be directed to D.F. King Co., Inc. by telephone at 800.901.0068 (toll free) or 212.269.5550 (collect) or in writing at 48 Wall Street, 22nd Floor, New York, New York 10005. Questions regarding the tender offers may be directed to Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. at 866.627.0391 (toll free) or 212.250.2955 (collect) or HSBC Securities (USA) Inc. at 888.HSBC.4LM (toll free) or 212.525.5552 (collect).

This press release is not a tender offer to purchase or a solicitation of acceptance of a tender offer, which may be made only pursuant to the terms of the Offer to Purchase. In any jurisdiction where the laws require the tender offers to be made by a licensed broker or dealer, the tender offer will be deemed made on behalf of the Company by Deutsche Bank Securities Inc., HSBC Securities (USA) Inc., Goldman, Sachs Co., BofA Merrill Lynch or one or more registered brokers or dealers under the laws of such jurisdiction.

About The Coca-Cola Company

The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE: KO) is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Along with Coca-Cola, recognized as the world's most valuable brand, the Company's portfolio includes 12 other billion dollar brands, including Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, Powerade, Minute Maid, Simply and Georgia. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, juices and juice drinks and ready-to-drink teas and coffees. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy the Company's beverages at a rate of 1.6 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that protect the environment, conserve resources and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate.

Forward-Looking Statements

Generally, the words "believe," "expect," "intend," "estimate," "anticipate," "project," "will" and similar expressions identify forward-looking statements, which generally are not historical in nature. Forward-looking statements are subject to certain risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from The Coca-Cola Company's historical experience and our present expectations or projections. These risks include, but are not limited to, obesity and other health concerns; scarcity and quality of water; changes in the nonalcoholic beverages business environment, including changes in consumer preferences based on health and nutrition considerations and obesity concerns; shifting consumer tastes and needs, changes in lifestyles and competitive product and pricing pressures; impact of the global credit crisis on our liquidity and financial performance; increased competition; our ability to expand our operations in developing and emerging markets; foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations; increases in interest rates; our ability to maintain good relationships with our bottling partners; the financial condition of our bottling partners; increases in income tax rates or changes in income tax laws; increases in indirect taxes or new indirect taxes; our ability and the ability of our bottling partners to maintain good labor relations, including the ability to renew collective bargaining agreements on satisfactory terms and avoid strikes, work stoppages or labor unrest; increase in the cost, disruption of supply or shortage of energy; increase in cost, disruption of supply or shortage of ingredients or packaging materials; changes in laws and regulations relating to beverage containers and packaging, including container deposit, recycling, eco-tax and/or product stewardship laws or regulations; adoption of significant additional labeling or warning requirements; unfavorable general economic conditions in the United States or other major markets; unfavorable economic and political conditions in international markets, including civil unrest and product boycotts; changes in commercial or market practices and business model within the European Union; litigation uncertainties; adverse weather conditions; our ability to maintain brand image and corporate reputation as well as other product issues such as product recalls; changes in legal and regulatory environments; changes in accounting standards and taxation requirements; our ability to achieve overall long-term goals; our ability to protect our information systems; additional impairment charges; our ability to successfully manage Company-owned bottling operations; the impact of climate change on our business; global or regional catastrophic events; risks related to our acquisition of Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc.'s North American operations; and other risks discussed in our Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), including our Annual Report on Form 10-K, which filings are available from the SEC. (NASDAQ: SNMX), a leading company focused on using proprietary taste receptor technologies to discover and develop novel flavor ingredients for the food, beverage, and ingredient supply industries, announced today that Kent Snyder, the Company’s Chief Executive Officer, and Tony Rogers, Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, will present a corporate overview on Thursday, December 2, 2010 at 11:00 a.m. Eastern Time (8:00 a.m. Pacific Time) during the J.P. To access the live presentation or a subsequent archived recording, please log onto Senomyx’s website at http://www.senomyx.com and click on the “Investor Relations” tab. Senomyx is a leading company using proprietary taste receptor technologies to discover and develop novel flavor ingredients in the savory, sweet, salt, bitter, and cooling areas. The Company has product discovery and development collaborations with global food, beverage, and ingredient supply companies, some of which are currently marketing products that contain Senomyx’s flavor ingredients. For more information, please visit www.senomyx.com.

entry.headline: Aastra Launches IP Phones for Microsoft Lync
entry.body: TORONTO, ONTARIO, Nov 23 (MARKET WIRE) -- Aastra, a leading company at the forefront of the enterprise communication market, announced that its Aastra IP Phones for Microsoft(R) Lync(TM) are now available for sale in conjunction with the release of Microsoft Lync. The Aastra 6721ip and 6725ip phones deliver exceptional quality and value while tightly integrating with Microsoft Lync, making them powerful unified communications (UC) devices. These phones can operate independently from a PC so can be easily and widely deployed. The Aastra 6725ip offers the additional benefits of PC connection via USB cable for a tight integration with Microsoft(R) Lync(TM) Server 2010: click-to-dial is enriched with presence status ensuring a more efficient call management for business users and team collaboration. The Aastra 6721ip and 6725ip phones were designed to provide a superior user experience and facilitate the adoption of unified communications including: -- an intuitive interface clearly displayed on a full color 3.5" LCD screen; -- easy access to the most essential calling features through navigation keys; and -- wideband audio which enhances the clarity of all calls, a particular benefit for companies doing business internationally. "The launch of the 6721ip and 6725ip continues Aastra's strategy of providing great choice, high quality and value to the enterprise communications market," said Bruce Cook, Vice President of Sales for Canada. "We're excited about this opportunity to work together with Microsoft to deliver compelling UC solutions to meet the demanding needs of today's workers to communicate in a variety of ways." To learn more about the 6721ip or 6725ip, please visit www.aastra.com/lyncphones. About Aastra Telecom Aastra Telecom is a Canadian business unit of Aastra Technologies Limited, (TSX: AAH), a leading company at the forefront of the enterprise communication market. Headquartered in Concord, Ontario, Canada, Aastra develops and delivers innovative communications products and applications for businesses. Aastra's operations are truly global with more than 50 million installed lines around the world and a direct and indirect presence in more than 100 countries. Aastra is entirely dedicated to enterprise communications and offers one of the most complete portfolios of unified communications solutions individually tailored to satisfy its customers' requirements. These range from feature-rich call managers for small and medium businesses and highly scalable ones for large enterprises, integrated mobility, and call centres solutions to a wide selection of terminals. With a strong focus on open standards, Aastra enables enterprises to communicate and collaborate more efficiently. For additional information on Aastra, visit our website at http://www.aastra.com. Contacts: Media contact: Aastra Telecom Steve Hawkins +1.905.760.4251 shawkins@aastra.com www.aastra.com Copyright 2010, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-
